author: Adam Patridge
name: Template creator: make a directory a 'dotnet new' template

templateIdGeneratedGuidFallback.description: A GUID generated to serve as the template's unique identifier if one isn't provided at generation.

templateId.description: The unique identifier for your template within the .NET Core SDK system.

templateIdReplacer.description: A symbol generated by trying to use the "templateId" value, but falling back on "templateIdGeneratedGuidFallback" if it isn't provided.

classificationsQuotedCsv.description: A list of descriptions applicable to your template, in the form of `"Something", "Awesome"`. (WARNING: The .NET Core SDK v2.1.300 has a bug with escaped characters in parameter values, so do not use this value [yet]. [Fixed in https://github.com/dotnet/templating/issues/1542])

templateName.description: The template name displayed in `dotnet new --list`.

templateShortName.description: The template name used to generate content with `dotnet new {shortName}`.
